summary: "Red" is Taylor Swift's fourth album, released in 2012. It's about heartbreak and has a mix of pop, country, and rock sounds. Swift worked with new producers to try different music styles. The album got mostly good reviews for her songwriting, but some critics didn't like the mix of production styles. It had hit singles like "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" and was a big success, topping charts in many countries. Swift even re-recorded the album in 2021 after a dispute over its ownership.
title: Red (Taylor Swift album)
